reviewText:
I wanted this game to be good.... #FAIL

I'm sitting here trying to find a list of pros about this game and I'm actually drawing a blank. And listen, that pains me to say, because I wanted this game to be another great naval warfare game to play. Right now World of Warships has a monopoly on the genre and this game is no competition. I guess I will pick it apart...

First, ships travel WAY too fast and are completely out of perspective. The distance marker says you're 2km away, yet you can still see details on the ship that shouldn't be visible from that distance... (I realize many people won't care about this but it take away from the immersion and therefore is a con)

Next, and this is game breaking, there is no friendly fire... I literally watched a player shoot his torpedo through his teammate's ship (that's right THROUGH IT!!) so he could sink his enemy!!! WOW! This one aspect alone is what made me uninstall the game. No friendly fire, and ghosting is a game breaking mechanic.

Sailing your ship is like walking in a FPS, using WASD, you literally have to keep the keys pressed the whole time to move... it's not sailing, it's walking on water... and it's not enjoyable at all.

The tech tree is EXTREMELY hard to read. I use a 49 1080p monitor and I had to get 3 feet away from the screen to actually see the thumbnails. There's no harbor preview
date: just a spreadsheet for the stats and a tiny marker to tell you what kind of ship it is; DD

reviewText:
What could be, perhaps should be, a lot of fun as a game is completely defeated by invisible ships that magically appear a few hundred yards off your port or starboard quarter while you are dealing with someone else in the other direction several thousand yards away.  Total BS.  The developers seem not to comprehend that the primary purpose of those incredibly tall masts was to see with the aided eye 20 to 40 miles away.  But, no, whole squadrons magically appear, then often enough disappear as you attempt to target disappearing ships only a few hundred yards away.  Hardly worth playing when you think you have maneuvered well only to find yourself suddenly surrounded at short range.  Must have been hiding behind that big wave yonder, I suppose.

That's just stupid.

The lack of promotion is also weird, limiting population, hence limiting motivation to contribute real money to this toy.

Dink with it as a freebie, enjoy the rare moments of team play and avoid getting upset when the invisible armada hits you from six directions all at once, and none more than 500 yards or so away.

History's blindest lookouts make this an absurdity, so play it as such, and perhaps through that amazing miasmic fog we might yet discover how the developers plan on making money from this albatross.  The suck you in" then dole out copious amounts of real dough I consider more scam than market strategy
date: but it sinks of its lack of weight as of this writing because it out-arcades the arcade."

reviewText:
Steel Ocean is a naval warfare MMOG where you can control naval vessels that were built or were on paper before, during and shortly after WWII.
Pros:
-Control of the secondary battery on battleships and AA on all ships that have it. No RNG here, just who can shoot better.
-No aim assist for torpedoes, and you can fire torpedoes individually or in a salvo, this makes the the torpedo an area denial/ distraction weapon for the ships that have it.
-Arm time for torpedoes eliminates DD/CL suicide runs.
-The longer you focus your aim, the tighter the spread, again, no RNG here, the patient ones can hit a lot more than the one who is shooting wildly.
-The presence of submarines in the game (unrealistic as they are), forces destroyers and light cruisers to play a bigger role than just a scout, protecting the heavy cruisers and battleships and forces players to work as a cohesive unit.
-Premium items are hardly, if at all noticeable.
-Aircraft carriers can customize their wing, which can help players who wants to tune their wing to defense (fighters for escort) or offense (dive and torpedo bombers).
-Aircraft carriers can also take control of their main battery (DP cannons) which can give them a fighting chance against destroyers and light cruisers.
-Night battle mode, which has players using star shells and spotlights to spot and engage hostile warships. A very fun mode.
-More nations, though some of them are incomplete and mostly premium ships, though it will inevitably grow as the game develops.
-Movement of the ships affects accuracy, which is kinda realistic. This is especially true in the older warships and the Japanese ships which historically used optical rangefinders  (cannot include gun-laying radar ingame for obvious reasons). Zig- zagging while firing your cannons ain't gonna do much here.
-Faster shells, in WoWs, the shells feel more like guided missiles.
-Decent grinding to unlock ships and equipment.
-Commander system where the commanders assigned to ships give the ship a boost in certain stats (speed, firepower, reload time, durability) When a commander is assigned to become a captain, he can use a skill which can drastically increase a certain stat for a limited amount of time.
-Rewards for logging in consecutively for a number of days such as commanders and ships.
Cons:
-One server (NA) which presents difficulties for other players to enjoy the game, though if this game grows they will have to open new servers due to the player traffic.
-No seperate tech trees for light and heavy cruisers, forcing players to change playstyles frequently to play the cruisers.
-Price for premium ships are ridiculous.
-Wonky physics, with battleships getting up to speed in seconds.
-Game is dying, lack of players.
-Crashes up the wazoo.

EDIT: Now they have introduced a German proxy, does wonders to non-NA players. Still experiencing a lot of crashes.
voteText: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
First, I must tell you that I have never played WOWS.

Steel Ocean is a good mixture between WoT, Navyfield and Battlestations Midway.

I love this game, because it is good balanced and every ship have its role.
For example: A single destroyer can scout for enemy ships while the battleships are staying in the dark and making high damages with artillery from far away.

The tech trees has diffrent lines, like Destroyer, Cruisers, Battleships, Carriers and of course Subs.
No need to level through of tons of destroyers and cruisers before getting a battleships, your second ship can be your first battleship. Only heavy cruisers are hard too reach.
The Japanese and US-Navy have a complete ship tree. In the german tree the destroyers and carriers are still missing.
A UK-, China- and France-Navy are coming too.

The graphics are not the best, but good but the sounds are great.
The matchmaking works fast and is good balanced.
This game just makes fun. There a gold items you can buy, but it is not really a pay to win.
The most important thing you should buy are ships slots, because there are a lot of ships you can get.


EDIT: 31.12.2015
Meanwhile some Lines of UK has arrived (CV,DD).

Figured out that Destroyers can be more dangerous than Battleships. In some battles i sunk some battleships with my torps, because they ignored me.
I still love this game because with the right tactics you can win and rule the game. Teamplay is the key.

If you are a good player than you can easily afford Camouflages, flags and expensive ship upgrades.
In later gameplay you can also pimp your ship with the right combination of commanders.

There are some daily, weekly and monthly events, which brings you a great things to unlock like Free XP, Silver-Money, VIP-Access, consumables and points to unlock new commanders.


BTW: I tried World of Warships too, but it makes no fun for me.
- no subs
- CPU controlled guns (secondary and AA)
- torpedo angle precalculation
- no aiming circle
- autopilot?

reviewText:
Steel Oceans is a fun game to play, there's no denying that but, it does come with some serious problems that you should be aware of.
1. Optimization is terrible right now and no word of when if ever they will work on it.
2. The blocks in chat make it all but impossible to have a meaningful discussion.
3. 2. is probably because of the terrible immature players in chat. Very little is any kind of help about game. Its like listening to a lot of 8 yr old's giggling and whispering naughty words to each other. It needs a moderator bad and they wont get one or can't.
3. The lack of communication from SO in forum leaves one feeling they have abandoned the game.
4. NA server is so lacking in players you have many games at 3 vs 3 when it should be 15 vs 15.
5 Although they have fair tutorial on how to use your ships, they have nothing on how the commanders work except a slightly confusing, short script of what they do. It could be a lot better.
6. Lastly the updates are rather few, small, (not much content) and not very dynamic.
NOTE: as I said, if you can shrugg off all of these, the game is for a while at least fun.
And yes I have about 500 + games in it and am good at it. I do think unless something changes, this game will at best just dribble on for a while then slowly vanish, poof

reviewText:
Product received for free

The game seems solid, it looks good, it runs well, the tutorials are pretty excellent.

However, there is no real playerbase active. Getting into PvP matches takes really long and usually ends up with 3v3. The PvE is basically unplayable because the bots only care about other bots and do not consider the player to be present at all. Meaning you will be dodging torpedoes from friendly bots more than anything else. Bots will ram you, push you off course if they want to make to make a turn.

Maybe this game is playable if there were many more players online. But the fact is there aren't. Getting a queue with more than 30 players in it in total is an exception.

Last but not least there is only a North American server. I normally have excellent pings to game servers in the EU, but this server gives me 130ms latency at the bare minimum. Even the ingame indicator says my connection isn't good enough.

So with the terrible lag on the server, the lack of a playerbase. It doesn't matter how good the game is, because it's not possible to play the game to any depth.

reviewText:
This popped up once as a Steam recommendation for me and I wasn't sure I would like this game as I have played others along the same lines. At first glance, there were some things that bothered me, such as the flawed chat censoring that borders on funny with what it does/doesn't filter.

However, the more I have played, the deeper I have been pulled into the game. I hear complaints all the time about how this or that is unbalanced, but generally I have found it is the person and not the game that is unbalanced. Some complain about subs or carriers being too weak, but played well they can be the terrors in a fight. Part of this is also that some classes of ship get better at higher tiers (i.e. levels).

The game is actually very complex and part of the problem is many players don't learn the role of their ship well. For instance, spotting is based on a wide variety of factors (capability of the ship, upgrades, commanders, equipment, speed, etc) and destoyers are the primary spotters for their side. However many players will charge in with their destroyer to attempt close range torpedo runs (which can be deadly) and die quickly due to their low armor. Battleships without something to spot for them are considerably more disadvantaged despite all the firepower at their disposal.

Another example is that the part of the ship you hit also has a significant impact on the amount of damage you do and the parts of the ship that you can damage destroy. This is something you start to learn and try to take advantage of as you play. Beyond that, your choice of commanders can make a significant difference in many ways: do you want to be more accurate, do more damage when you hit, see further, reload faster, etc.

Sure, there are paid options that can help give a player some advantages (true in any type of game like this), but they aren't absolute trump cards like some games. Sure,  you can buy gold" ammo/torpedoes
date: but they still have to hit you with them to make them count. There are "gold" ships
recommended: but typically they aren't any better than a fully upgraded ship of the same tier (i.e. level). You can spend gold to get more commanders
hoursPlayed: but there are options to get commanders without gold as well

reviewText: Dont even bother. This is a failed reskin of World of Warships that was made because, and this is just my guess, some of the devs for this didnt get into the World of Warships alpha, so they cried and then put out this failure of a game. It is not ballanced in any shape or way. DO NOT BOTHER! The only thing that this has over World of Warships is the fact that the matches are much more fair in the sense that you wont get into a match against something more than 1 tier above you. But because this sorry excuse of a game has nobody playing it other than a few hundred people at a time, end game is at tier 5 rather than the tier 10 which the game goes up to. All the people that play stay at tier 1-3 because those are where they encounter the most games. And if you decide to play this, dont even bother playing Submarines. Their combat is so unbalanced because the only weapons they have at their disposal is broken and has a minimum range so if you hit an enemy in that range, you essentially do nothing. I would say save your time and find something better or wait for either this or World of Warships devs to get their ♥♥♥♥ together, but should you play either I wish you the best of luck.

reviewText: This game has me on the fence. Apart from that issue, the rest of the game was very enjoyable, with great ship modles and impressive sound design too. reviewText:
Some people reviews calls this a World of Warships clone,  It's not a clone cause this game has stuff World of Warships does not.

+ Gunnery requires skill. The longer you aim the more accurate the guns will become. Turning the vessel or gun even a little bit will spoil your shot.

+ Torpedoes require skill cause there's no overlay telling you exactly when and where to shoot torps. If you want to shoot an entire volley into a battleship you will need to get close to it. A battleship secondaries can hit you hard if you do.

+ Direct control of secondaries weapons including AA guns.

+ There is Submarines.

+ Battleship main batteries hit hard and If you land a solid volley it's toast.

+ More advanced crew management. There are a lot of different crewmen with a huge variety of activated skills, and they acquire more skills with experience.

+ Progression is just like world of warships. You upgrade individual parts of the ship.

+ There's a very unique investment" system
date: whereby you can invest gold in your future progression
recommended: which will pay off with interest as you unlock higher tiers.\n\n+ A renown system which you can play to increase your rank. Rewards are given out at the end of each "season" based upon the rank you achieve. Better play increases your rank
hoursPlayed: and vice versa.\n\n+ Buy gold direct through the Steam wallet if you choose too."

reviewText:
I'd first like to highlight this one thing i noticed while comparing this game to WoWS. It is more of a WoT relative than a WoWS relative. What that means is WoWS mechanics are drastically different than WoT, and rightfully so, as a ship is drastically different from a tank. Steel Ocean basically carries a lot of similar mechanics that you would see in WoT, such as aiming circles, repair kits as consumables, crew slots instead of 1 commander, etc. While I haven't played enough to decide whether or not I like how this is implemented, it does make the game different enough from WoWS to be worth playing.

Now for some pros and cons.

Pros:
- Gameplay seems a bit more skill based than WoWS with things such as no aim assist with the guns and torpedos, and that you are in full control over your guns ie secondaries and AA do not fire on their own. You switch to them and fire them yourself.
-High variety of playstyles. With 6 different classes of ships, this game does offer more variety.
-Smooth gameplay that will run on most computers.
-More fast paced than WoWS. This detracts from the realism a bit but at the same time it keeps the entertainment going.
-Familiar mechanics yet still feel fresh.
-Thorough tutorial.
-Rewards players for in game actions.

Cons:
-Graphically very dated.
-UI, especially in menus is very small and seems to have a poor resolution. at 1080p on my 42 TV it is difficult to make out a lot of the text.
-Poor sound fidelty.

However the biggest con of all for me personally is the cost of any premium content in the game. This will be the main reason why I cant justify playing this game. I am a fairly competitive player
date: and I know that in these FtP games
hoursPlayed: premium time and other premium (paid) content really does help. Most FtP games do a good job of not making their premium content overpowered so as to make it a pay to win enviroment
voteText:
but the content is generally very beneficial in other aspects.

The problem here is the cost of the content. 180 days of premium time (VIP time in game) is very high. You're looking at  50$ USD for 180 days. So 100$ per year. Thats more than an Xbox live subscription by almost double. There are premium ships that will cost around 100$. Conversion of gold to silver gives you 170 in game currency for 1$ USD. That amount of silver wont even buy most tier 1-2 ships upgrades.

I will admit
helpfulPercent: when i play these FtP games i like to play it on premium. The dev should deserve money for their creation
votesHelpful: but the costs are way to high
votesTotal: especially since I have to factor in converting USD to CAD.\n\nUntil the prices drop I cannot afford to play this game
votesFunny: and will have a hard time enjoying it compared to WoWS when i can afford to play that one on Prem time."

reviewText:
Alright I have played about 11,5h thats not to much but I played a little more than a quarter of the American Tree so I can tell you what I like and dislike.

First off I want to say  you get free Gold sometime for completing stuff etc. to buy XP or convert gold for coins and so on.

The game has some features I like:

+The Guns accuracy: The guns are only accurate if you leave them locked in for a few seconds, if you move them they have to adjust again.
+Submarines, SUBMARINES! I think that speaks for itself. Even though they are kinda hard to play.
+Aircraftcarriers: You can adjust your plane setup as much as you want it to be, not like in WOWs where you have pregiven setups.
+ You can control: Main battery, AA GUNS, Torpedoes (Fire one at a time). You can also drop underwater charges from a cruiser to give submarines a hard time. Only Machineguns are controlled by AI.
+More things to research.
+ Customization for ingame Cash -> Lasts only for 7 Days but its not that expensive if you are good player. I think 12k for a camo, thats not much.
+ The Grind: Grinding isnt a pain in the a** that much, it becomes harder if you go up the Tiers and thats good in my opinion because you keep a ship longer and learn more about it's strenghtes and weaknesses.
+ Runs good on weaker PC's, much adjustment to the graphics can be done.

Theres more, find out for yourself, but every good game brings negative aspects with it.

- Physics: The ships accelerate to fast and stop to fast, the weight of the Ships is not to much of a factor yet.
- Shipclasses: The Battleships are crushing right now, the main guns shred everything, hope it's going to be nerfed.
- Matchmaking: Because many people play Battleships right now or Submarines in lower tiers, the matchmaking becomes odd sometimes but you never play with Ships that are higher than 2 Tiers, except you play with a friend who is Tier 3 when you are Tier 1.
- Performance: With some things in the graphics the performance gets kind of bad, the FPS drop down to 20, the game isn't very old so it's more of a hopefully gets fixed" negative point.
- No European server
date: normally american server is no problem for me
recommended: if my internet has a bad day
hoursPlayed: I am unable to play but same as above
voteText: they will most likely work on that.\n\nThese are my main points I want to Stick out to the people thinking about getting the game
helpfulPercent: it's for free and the dev's are working constantly on it
votesHelpful: so give it a shot.\n\nIn the end I can say that this game surprised me in a positive way and I think there is much to come."

reviewText:
I have, what I feel, are quite a few hours invested into this game now, and I really enjoy this game. After stumbling across this I looked for others similar and came across World of Warships, so this is mostly comparing to that game.

This game seems to focus more on realism than WoWS. The travel speed of the ships, the responsiveness to turning, the rate of fire of the cannons/torpedoes/AA/etc feel much more real.

The graphics are beautiful, the ocean looks very realistic. The physics are great, but would like to see some more variation in the waves. The ships look awesome and are incredibly detailed. Customization is fairly minimal, with a set list of patterns avaialble and flags as options. This will transition into the cons of the game as these customizations are only avaialble permanently with the purchase of gold with real money.

The cons of this game come in to the upgrade system I feel. With 33.1 hrs in game at this point, playing between submarines and battleships, I have only been able to achieve a rank 5 ship. Moving forward from here I feel the upgrades are coming to come much slower. With the amount of XP required almost doubling each rank, without paying for their Premium Gold, which is rather expensive, seems like it woulds take hundreds of hours to reach rank 10.

To purchase even one of the cheapest avaialble ships via Gold, you're looking at probably spending 50+ dollars, and this would only get you about as far as rank 5 as well. The farthest avaialble gold purchase only seems to be rank 8 as well, which I personally feel is great since you can't immediately skip to the end, but again to reach this rank immediately would be looking at +$100 US to purchase.

Overall, as a casual player this game is a load of fun, and would recommend this game to anyone. Especially being free to play.

reviewText:
I have, what I feel, are quite a few hours invested into this game now, and I really enjoy this game. After stumbling across this I looked for others similar and came across World of Warships, so this is mostly comparing to that game.

This game seems to focus more on realism than WoWS. The travel speed of the ships, the responsiveness to turning, the rate of fire of the cannons/torpedoes/AA/etc feel much more real.

The graphics are beautiful, the ocean looks very realistic. The physics are great, but would like to see some more variation in the waves. The ships look awesome and are incredibly detailed. Customization is fairly minimal, with a set list of patterns avaialble and flags as options. This will transition into the cons of the game as these customizations are only avaialble permanently with the purchase of gold with real money.

The cons of this game come in to the upgrade system I feel. With 33.1 hrs in game at this point, playing between submarines and battleships, I have only been able to achieve a rank 5 ship. Moving forward from here I feel the upgrades are coming to come much slower. With the amount of XP required almost doubling each rank, without paying for their Premium Gold, which is rather expensive, seems like it woulds take hundreds of hours to reach rank 10.

To purchase even one of the cheapest avaialble ships via Gold, you're looking at probably spending 50+ dollars, and this would only get you about as far as rank 5 as well. The farthest avaialble gold purchase only seems to be rank 8 as well, which I personally feel is great since you can't immediately skip to the end, but again to reach this rank immediately would be looking at +$100 US to purchase.

Overall, as a casual player this game is a load of fun, and would recommend this game to anyone. Especially being free to play.

reviewText:
This game is just simply amazing. Ive never played World of Warships but when Im in global chat all I see if every ranting about how much better this game is. But overall, this game is a must get :)

reviewText:
First things first, I have never played WoWS before. When I was looking for a naval combat game it was between Steel Ocean and WoWS. As a naval warship simulation newb, I chose SO because it offers more control over the ships and seemed to have more realistic artillery aiming, not to mention ammunition limits. While the graphics are not as good as WoWS, they aren't bad enough to want to sacrifice a more well rounded naval experience
But I don't want this to turn into a comparison, there are enough of those available.

Anyways, this game has pretty much had me hooked. From battle one, which I'm sure I was promptly turned into a hulking wreck, it had me wanting to do more battle. The more you die, the more you want to keep playing to get revenge or to tame your bruised ego. The satisfaction you get from blowing the **** out of your chosen enemy, dodging torpedos, multitasking steering and firing, and just watching the general mayhem is just too fun. Once you get a grasp of victory and start developing your ships and strategies, the fun doesn't stop. Victory truly is sweet in this game.

You don't really need to pay too much, if at all, to get some enjoyment out of the free to play game. I have paid about $20USD and I feel it's justified to speed up the ship upgrade process and get some additional perks without grinding too much.

For a free to play game, you can't go wrong to try. Always players online to battle. The more the merrier.  Just waiting for even more ships, maps and features. A game you can just grind yourself on and lose track of time.

8/10

reviewText:
This game beats World of Warship (WoWS) in many aspects. Having night battles which WoWS doesn't have yet. I won't be arguing much with those WoWS fanboys because I've played WoWS myself and compared the two. I can say this game is way more better than WoWS. Others say that this game is purely arcade than WoWS which is true but WoWS itself is an arcade game too.

Steel Ocean's gameplay is fast forwarded like 1.5x that's why you can see that shells fly faster, torpedo travels faster, ship moves faster, turret moves faster and so on. WoWS is into realism but not very realistic than War Thunder therefore it is still arcade. WoWS will let you play in a realistic-like naval warfare that will consume much of your time playing that game just by turning your turret, sailling etc..

If you wanna play this game in the highest graphics then be sure you are confident about it. The graphics of Steel Ocean has a lot of effort put in. WoWS fanboys deny this fact because they THINK that WoWS graphics is better but its actually the opposite.

The only positive thing I can say about WoWS is that it gives you more options to control the ship although most of them won't be used that much in every sortie.

reviewText:
This game is fun, but  it needs some more balancing and larger maps. Eu server and larger community specially tier+6.

Also got lots of different gameplay modes. Like Flagship, competition mode, night battles etc

And it also got neat commanders that give your ship buffs. So it makes gameplay really interesting.

And its really all about teamwork, or kind of rock vs siccor. If your team is working together its almost certain for victory, But if you go alone you will lose.

BB  is good against all if you manage to hit, its like sniper or artillery. scouting range sucks. but some carry scout planes.

CA is like bb but with faster fire rate and smaller guns, but its really good against DD or other CA CL CV, can get some nasty hits on BB also. scouting range sucks. But some carry scout planes.

CL is anti sub dd CA CV. can scout better than BB and CA, some got scout planes.. also really fast.


DD is anti sub and dd. And the most important in your team. Since they are the main scout, scout best in team. Lose all your dd and you will lose. Becuse your team will be blind. its also very fast and hard to hit.

SS is very deadly if it can sneak up to your BB and CA. and harass behind enemy lines.

CV is a little bit of all, it can scout, deal heavy damage etc.

And this game is more realstic, In that case that you just cant get close with your DD or cruiser head on against BB. Becuse your shells will just bounce off that BB or CA. So if you have played WoWs this will be a suprise to you.

reviewText: Great naval battle game. Far from a simulation, but realistic enough to keep you going. The game is very well playable without going for the in-game purchases - so the 'free-to-play' really does apply. I'd be much happier though if this game offered a 'unlock' purchase for the full game experience instead of the aweful buy-in-game-currency system, but I get why the developer chose this option. Nontheless - it's fun and can become addictive (partially because of the frustration it sometimes invokes when you're so close to blowing up that enemy cruiser, only to be downed by one of their submarines.)\n\nGraphics are great when playing on ultra setting on a high resolution. Also tried playing it on a lower resolution on a lower setting on my laptop - but that was a complete and utter failure - really becomes unplayeable on low settings.

reviewText:
A brilliant game marred by a lack of promotional effort to increase the player base. There's a lot to love and for the most part it is done very well - my single biggest gripe is connection issues, but these would be resolved if more people signed up to try - as the population expands it's worth the development team adding more server facility. Of course this is an assumption, but it's a reasonable one.

Primarily the game is PVP, but there are reasonable PVE tutorials with friends, to allow you to try the mechanics for yourself.

Given it's free, if you like WWII ship combat, you want to actually sail and aim (nothing overwhelmingly complex, but also a requirement for skill and intelligence) and you like having a variety of ship choices and some degree of customisation, plus the choice of ship size .. sub, destroyer, light and heavy cruisers, battleships and carriers .. I'd suggest you try it and see what you think.

reviewText: This is honestly the best naval war game I have played.
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
TL:DR available at the end!

At first sight it seems to be a good game...
+ Huge variety of ships - Great!
+ You can aim EVERY gun in your ship (manual AA guns, etc...) - Cool!
+ Good damage system. A ship taking a full salvo on magazine + engine + fuel tanks should not stay up for long, unlike in World of Warships - Mehh... depends on tastes
+ SUBMARINES!!!! Take that World of Warships!! - Y no subs in WoWs???
+ No aiming assistance, unlike in World of Warships - We aren't idiots, we can aim out turrets...
+ Nice maps - open sea maps are awesome and add another level of strategy to the game that does not exist in WoWs
+ Limited amount of ammunition - Nuff said
+ Low system requirements - You don't need a GTX 980 to run this game

... but soon after trying the game I found it's flaws, and they can't be ignored.
- Low system requirements - Crappy graphics, perhaps a stone age game engine?
- No physics whatsoever - Impossible to hit with a torpedo because ships can turn and stop almost instantly
- Copy of WG games in a lot of ways - The aiming circle of each turret is the same as the aiming circle of Arty's on WoT (although this is awesome the rest of the stuff makes people become enraged at this game for copying WG...)

This game takes World of Warships, World of Tanks and Navyfield, and then adds the stuff that's missing to WoWs, like submarines and better control over the Aircraft Carrier's loadouts (using a system incredibly similar to the WoT interface for choosing cunsumables, shells loaded, etc...), and it looks like Navyfield in so many ways...

BUT, it all ends after you see that the ship physics are garbage, ships accelerate and turn as fast as my car and because of that you can only hit the enemy with torps if one of the following occurs:
> Enemy is dumb
> You fire the torpedoes at 100 meters distance from the target
> You throw the torpedoes with your bare hands at the deck of the enemy ship

I played Navyfield for a long time, and I could handle the graphics of this game easily because most mechanics are enjoyable and well made, and being a copy of WG's games is not always bad, I would copy almost everything from this game to WoWs because it would make WoWs a GOD, or as it should be in the first place, but the physics kill the game, it makes the game feel more arcadeish than most arcade-like games.

TL:DR: Try the game! It is a game with awesome mechanics (except physics), and if you've played WoWs you'll be thinking Why isn't this on WoWs yet???"

recommended: and if you've played any of these you'll feel comfortable with the gameplay

reviewText:
This is a game about WW I and WW II ships, with a series of interesting and realistic game mechanics.

Pros:
Complex, compared to WoW there are more dimensions of gameplay and game mechanics that make the game very interesting.
Features subs, destroyers, cruisers, battleships and carriers, each with it's specific gameplay, challenging at times but not without skill based solutions.
Medium/fast paced, you don't waste a ton of time waiting for things to happen, you're making the most of your time.
Ship Captains - this collectable captains allow you to customize your ship performance in very enjoyable way.

Cons:
Chat censorship. What is this? China? Jokes aside who decided what words to censor prob isn't fluent in english.
Difference between tiers is high.
Some ships are a bit too responsive and fast  and don't require much planning (but not by much)
Overwhelming at times, having to control main guns, secondaries and AAA can be a bit hard at times. ...and airplanes are extremelly micro intensive.

Overall I recomend this game and enjoy it greatly.
Some people say it's arcadie" vs WoW but it couldn't be further from the truth

reviewText:
Excellent fleet tactics game. It will force you to work as a team or die alone and this aspect I love. Playing as a fleet will earn you many more victories than simply trying to get the most kills. Assist damage through spotting the enemy for your teamates is rewarded generously and I have had games where I've finished as MVP without firing a shot.

This game recieved a lot of negativity from reviewers about being pay to win, when most of these reviews had been to early into the game to really tell. With 600 battles and counting under my belt I can honestly say this is not the case. The biggest advantage one player can have over another is in commanders, whose skills can be used to boost certain attributes of your ship, they can be earned by completing daily/weekly quests. These commanders allow you to personalise your ships so you can focus on damage, speed, scouting and many more aspects; two ships of the class can be outfitted completely differently depending on your playstyle.

I do well in game and I have only ever purchased VIP time and port slots.

reviewText:
What can I say about this game?

Better then World of Warships - Yes and No.

I been playing World of Warships for sometime before I started playing Steel Ocean. An while I enjoy Steel Ocean a bit more, there is some aspects of both games that if both were able to join forces they would make a game that was seriously bad a$$.

Pros:
Torpedo Control is ALOT better then WoW.
Ships respond faster to controls.
Submarines!
More Playable Nations
Ship Classes have a different range of Tactics and forces a team to WORK AS A TEAM.
Easy to grind EXP on lower levels.
Anti Aircraft Gun Control **BANG BANG BANG** DIE DIRTY FLYING EARTHLINGS!
Better Carriers then WoW and Squadron Management.

Cons:
Graphics are not as pretty as WoW
Consumables are partly useless.. mainly smoke and COST ALOT of silver for basic things like repair, flood damage, fire control.
Alot of the aspect of decorations for ships, camo, converting EXP cost gold which supports devs are more interested in making money for players at higher levels.

Overall I enjoy this game, cause it has aspects of the game that are simply better then WoW. While I tried to get some of my other WoW friends to play it, they weren't as impressed to keep playing as I was. Seriously if the Devs joined forces with Wargaming WoW team and made a baby it would be a awesome experience and lay all other WWII Warship games to waste.

Try it out.. just can't promise you will stay on it for long.

reviewText:
Its your classic 'free' to play type game. You don't have to spend a single nickle to enjoy it. Graphics are good. Sound is fine. Playerbase is rather small right now, which is unfortunate since some of the matches will end up 5v5.
Many people compare it to World of Warships.
I would recommend downloading it and giving it a whirl. You might find you like it.

Update - 20 hours in-game
Well, I have ranked up in-game and have several Tier IV ships. All fun to play.
Really enjoying playing the DD class since taking out unsuspecting BBs is fun as heck. Going into an artillery/torp duel with other DDs and CLs is fun as well. Kill or be killed.

Playerbase continues to be small, especially during the week days. Weekends are better and you will see the larger 16v16 battles. Competition mode is interesting when the playerbase gets larger.

Is it 'fun'? Sure is and I haven't had to spend a single dime on the game. Don't think I will either since at this point it still feels like a 'beta' game and we need to see whether it grows. Its a nice change of space from War Thunder, Armored Warfare and World of Tanks. I needed the ocean scenery I guess. LOL

Download, learn it and give it a whirl. Its different so it will keep you entertained for a while. Just be aware that you WILL have to watch for the match making engine to generate a game. Play smart and be a team player...its what these games are about. No Ram-boners.

reviewText:
If your not a cheater - you will hate this game.

If you are a cheater - you will love this game.

Pros  - Game play and online battle engagements seem to function well.
- Developers are very good at stating that they do not allow cheating
- Really like the fact that each ship has a strength and a weakness which balances out the game experience
- Would like to see this game be a stand alone - purchased game - that a single player could campaign

Cons - Lack of missions
- Lack of maps - once you have seen 5 maps - that's it - gets boring
- Cheating and hacking issues by other players is experienced on a consistant basis - I've stopped playing
- Cheaters have the ability to jump to map points
- Cheaters have the ability of 1 shot KOs - will wipe out an entire team in under 4 min
- Cheaters have the ability to have missles curve to follow your ship
- Cheaters have the ability to fire 20 missles while the game only allows 5-6
- Cheaters have the ability to fire across the entire map when they have no scouting ships in area
- Cheaters have the ability to have zero impact damage when direct hits occur on them
- Some random 'out of nowhere' missles will take you out - I had a mountain fire missles and destroy my sub
- Pay as you go game - grind for 30 hours to upgrade - then find out it is not an upgrade when achieved
- Pay as you advance - many times notices pop up giving the impression that you have to pay to continue - ignore
- Pay to win - all good, if you have the $150.00 US to buy the upgrade - more power to you- cheaters will take you
- A few times, the wait to join the co-op matches are long - 8 to 10 min

reviewText:
I coudnt give a toss about WoWS, never played it

I wont compare it.

I Really like this, combat is quick, requires a lot of attention, a smattering of luck, and quick reflexes, tech trees are choc full of ship options, and the upgrades and equipement choices are varied and usefull.

Is it pay to win ?, well, for me, no, but to complete your commander roster, you will need to buy gold, or rely on merit points, but I dont see that being a barrier to enjoying the game, although gold options are all over the game, so beware, its free to play, so expect it.

Commanding a ship or sub is pretty easy, and the controls feel responsive, especially at lower tiers, before you hit the big slow heavies, yes, the smaller ships do rocket along, but they are doing in excess of 35 knots.

Graphic wise, the game does look a little dated, but its not a detriment to gamepley, which is butter smooth even on a low system

If you havnt played the other" game

reviewText:
SO vs WoWS

advantages
- Ships customization. You can decide how many ammo (HE, AP), planes (scout , fighters, tbombers, dbombers)  and special kits (repair kit, smokescreen etc)  bring on vessel.
- Guns. You can shoot with all cannons on ship. 1st artillery, 2nd artillery, AA guns.
- Air battle. You can change squads in battle. For example: You can start game with 3 groups of bombers, and later change formation. On next take off send 2 groups of fighters  and 1 group of bombers. CV are much better than WoWS.
- GB technology tree
- Submarines.
- Dynamic gameplay. No time for boring

disadvantages
- Ship controlling. Ships accelerates and stops too fast. Controlling is unrealistic. WoWS has betters ships behaviour.
- Graphic design.
- PC requirements. Game wont run on old computers.
- Small community. (Sometimes I have to wait 8-10 minuts for battle)

And one thing that can be plus or minus.
- Battleships targeting system is very similar to WoT artillery.

reviewText:
This is a great naval game. It only lacks an active large player base, so there are many matches 10v10 or less.

Compared to World of Warships:
*Speed and handling more realistic (no ice skating ships while turning)
*Carriers require more skill and it is best to stay close to your heavy hitting Battleships.
*Subs (which WoWs doesn't have) are just plain fun, and they are not overpowered. You will run out of oxygen, get chased by Destroyers, Cruisers, and Planes. You must also manage your limited torp supply. The deck guns are good on subs that have them.
*Destroyers and Cruisers roles feel far better in this game. In fact it is recommeded that you play with" your team and keep your ranges (radio
hoursPlayed:
spotting) in mind in relation to your team mates.
*Large artillary gains accuaracy with follow up shots in the same general area.
*The lack of pretty gfx that WoWs has is easily countered by the quality of the games mechanics.
*Night matches with flares. Need I say more?

TLDR: Give it a try!"

reviewText:
Hi All,

overall a good game to play but it has its pros and cons. ill try and keep it simple below.

Pros.

1. A good overall game but not as polished as WOW
2. Very easy to pick and play and become effectiev in game
3. Submarines are easy to play but difficult to master
4. Good community


Cons

1. Based totaly for NA
2. High cost of some T4/5 ships. people without VIP(Premium) have the x.p for the ship but not enough Silver (Causing math making problems)
3. EU playes can have long que times
4. Fleet battle difficult to play for EU players


Overall

I enjoy playing the game and mainly play in the evening with MANY EU playes that are on. The overall ultimate part of the game which is to join a fleet and participate io the fleet battle is very difficutlf for the average EU player...the fleet battle are held twice a week and start at 02:00 AM in the morning for 2 hours.

The problem with this means that the average EU player that doesn't play fleet battle doesnt earn the points to upgrade their crew. so in about 6-7 weeks the gap will be so big on ships crew it will be difficult to play fleet battle.


Reccomendation to developers

1. Either open a EU server or cater for your EU clients (i understand this may cost and licence problems) see option 2
2. change fleet battle system to take into consideration EU fleets. 19:00 - 21:00 GMT ish

Regards
TMTC

reviewText:
*Good Review!*

This IS a very fun game to play expecially if you like battleships, submarines, cruiser, aircraft carrier and much more. I've play it till Tier 5 and I am still hype for more. I main battleships and still having lots of fun no matter win or lose. Its a really fun game and i'll rate it 10/10, I've could have rate it 11/10 but there is few downside to this that and needs improvement.

*We need more PLAYERS to play! 60 players online = average of 2mins waiting.*

-Overwhelming the battleships is a really good pick to play but I also prefer submarine as they can go undetected and attack battleships like there is 1 rock hitting 2 birds.
-There is too many players using battleships (Including me). Aircraft carrier is a good choice as well because of the differents of type of planes that can be choose to battle.
-Overall the controls are awesome, the gameplay is sick and people... STOP TELLING THEM TO MAKE A BIGGER MAP. BIGGER MAP = 20mins of traveling! Get your fact straight as I've encounter lots of this nonsence..

Please invite your friends to play! It will be lots of fun I can assure that and if you don't find the controls good. Well, why don't you try a REAL ships huh. This game has just launch not long ago and there is lots of room for improvement! Help to develop this game guys!

AND REMEMBER! This is a FREE2PLAY game!

reviewText:
Had a surprising amount of fun with this game the short time I've played it. Highly recommended for anyone wanting some WWII naval combat action. The graphics aren't particularly pretty, but the gameplay is fantastic.

I feel the UI for managing your ships' officers could use a bit of work though, but aside from that, all of the other issues I've had with the game have been niggling at worst.

There's a huge amount of ships to choose from, and judging from the patch notes, they're continuing to add more. Furthermore, all of the ships seem to be relatively balanced in the sense that DDs don't feel inferior or superior to BBs since they serve a different tactical function. Also, in combat with each other, torpedoes hurt...  a lot.

Although I haven't played much, the matchmaking system seems really good. As opposed to players being divided purely by ELO, they're divided by ship classes. So, both sides will have the same number of DDs, SSs, CVs, etc... which makes a HUGE difference given that every ship class has its own inherent strengths and weaknesses (you will never have the horrible fate of a full team of SSs vs BBs/CVs).

All in all I'm glad I found out about this game and am looking forward to seeing it get updated.

reviewText:
Gameplay is awesome
- For a game thats less than 5 months old, I'm extremely impressed by the lack of bugs.
- PVP battles seem incredibly well implemented.
- Seeing updates that add entire ship categories for countries that previously had limited options is very exciting to see.
- This game allows for many playstles. For those who like to go completely ham, they are awarded with spotting bonuses, and despite the majority of game modes being single life, players have the ability to join new games with other ships while they wait for the one they died in to conclude.


UI could use some polishing:
- The ready-up button while in a party is kinda akwardly placed.
- While searching for a game disabling the entire UI except the cancel button is a poor choice. Being able to look through the tech tree would be nice.
- Many interface text for buttons appear to be missaligned (but they all still work), which likely is caused by differences in localization text.

reviewText:
What can I say about this game?

Better then World of Warships - Yes and No.

I been playing World of Warships for sometime before I started playing Steel Ocean. An while I enjoy Steel Ocean a bit more, there is some aspects of both games that if both were able to join forces they would make a game that was seriously bad a$$.

Pros:
Torpedo Control is ALOT better then WoW.
Ships respond faster to controls.
Submarines!
More Playable Nations
Ship Classes have a different range of Tactics and forces a team to WORK AS A TEAM.
Easy to grind EXP on lower levels.
Anti Aircraft Gun Control **BANG BANG BANG** DIE DIRTY FLYING EARTHLINGS!
Better Carriers then WoW and Squadron Management.

Cons:
Graphics are not as pretty as WoW
Consumables are partly useless.. mainly smoke and COST ALOT of silver for basic things like repair, flood damage, fire control.
Alot of the aspect of decorations for ships, camo, converting EXP cost gold which supports devs are more interested in making money for players at higher levels.

Overall I enjoy this game, cause it has aspects of the game that are simply better then WoW. While I tried to get some of my other WoW friends to play it, they weren't as impressed to keep playing as I was. Seriously if the Devs joined forces with Wargaming WoW team and made a baby it would be a awesome experience and lay all other WWII Warship games to waste.

Try it out.. just can't promise you will stay on it for long.

reviewText: Put in 40 hours in 3 1/2 days! Of course, some of that was studying controls, ships, commanders, etc. Well, was frustrating my first day. Cursing was not an issue for the first hour or so, then all of the sudden everyone started getting censored in chat. Even innocuous words! Okay, we're not all 7 year olds. Oh, well. Maybe it's because I report a couple guys for flaming people it got turned on. IDK.\n\nAnyway, today some very nice people clarified several things for me and I found myself REALLY enjoying this game. I was thinking about WOWS but those devs somehow got ahold of my xbox live account and literally spammed my email about playing on xbox live again". I NEVER linked that account. So glad Steel Ocean came along and I finally found it. Just a great game. Sure microtransactions and gold requirements are a bit high

reviewText:
Its your classic 'free' to play type game. You don't have to spend a single nickle to enjoy it. Graphics are good. Sound is fine. Playerbase is rather small right now, which is unfortunate since some of the matches will end up 5v5.
Many people compare it to World of Warships.
I would recommend downloading it and giving it a whirl. You might find you like it.

Update - 20 hours in-game
Well, I have ranked up in-game and have several Tier IV ships. All fun to play.
Really enjoying playing the DD class since taking out unsuspecting BBs is fun as heck. Going into an artillery/torp duel with other DDs and CLs is fun as well. Kill or be killed.

Playerbase continues to be small, especially during the week days. Weekends are better and you will see the larger 16v16 battles. Competition mode is interesting when the playerbase gets larger.

Is it 'fun'? Sure is and I haven't had to spend a single dime on the game. Don't think I will either since at this point it still feels like a 'beta' game and we need to see whether it grows. Its a nice change of space from War Thunder, Armored Warfare and World of Tanks. I needed the ocean scenery I guess. LOL

Download, learn it and give it a whirl. Its different so it will keep you entertained for a while. Just be aware that you WILL have to watch for the match making engine to generate a game. Play smart and be a team player...its what these games are about. No Ram-boners.

reviewText:
Teamwork,
Luckily stumbled onto this game day one.

It actually is a game about teamwork!!!!!!!

Each battle is something new and at the beginning you will likely suck as you need to learn to play as a team and not take on a fleet all by yourself. However once you start to get the hang of it and playing as a team and not a solo attacker this game is a blast and each kill is really rewarding.  The events are a really nice change of pace and their are about 6 different playing modes that you are randomly thrown into.  It's no suprise that World of Warships is spending lots of money on advertising since this game has come out. This game is free to play and really isn't pay to win.  Money might help you level your ships faster but really doesn't help you in game at least not that i've seen. I highly recommend this game.   If you find a good fleet (fun and cooperative) this game is really really fun.  Oh and yes their is subs... :)  It has its faults, in game voice chat doesn't work.  General chat is like WOW Barrens chat.  Servers can be sketchy at times.  However for the most part I love this game!

reviewText:
You already know what this game is. The fact that you are reading this means you are either desperate or trying to find something hilarious and original. This is World of Warships. It's just got submarines. That's pretty much the one selling point. No, that's wrong. World of Warships is the better game, You and I both know we're only here for the subs. Do I recommend this game?

If you like World of Warships, no.


If you want a game with good combat, great graphics and is basically World of Warships with submarines, then also no.

If you want a game that feels like World of Warships, but doesn't have to look like it (with submarines) again, no.

If you want a game that is basically just a giant headache with submarines and dank bettleshoops, then this is your game! Slam that download button with your absolute mighty fury!

Don't let the magic hyper-turning turrets turn YOU away from this game! Those submarines won't wait for you! Prepare your cringe-o-meter, this one's a wild ride!

I wont compare it.

I Really like this, combat is quick, requires a lot of attention, a smattering of luck, and quick reflexes, tech trees are choc full of ship options, and the upgrades and equipement choices are varied and usefull.

Is it pay to win ?, well, for me, no, but to complete your commander roster, you will need to buy gold, or rely on merit points, but I dont see that being a barrier to enjoying the game, although gold options are all over the game, so beware, its free to play, so expect it.

Commanding a ship or sub is pretty easy, and the controls feel responsive, especially at lower tiers, before you hit the big slow heavies, yes, the smaller ships do rocket along, but they are doing in excess of 35 knots.

Graphic wise, the game does look a little dated, but its not a detriment to gamepley, which is butter smooth even on a low system

If you havnt played the other" game

reviewText:
Steel  Ocean is the Naval War Tunder to rival World of Warships.

The attention to structure damage makes the accuracy of your shots great importance while the HP bars make it so one lucky shot wont kill you (unless ammo goes up), and a dozen shots dont have to hit a sweet spot from 6 clicks away just to kill. Game play is smooth and easy to pick up.

The laguage filter is garbage, can use half the Sailors 13 but can't say bigger, or god (among other words) without ur msg lookin like naval intel took a black marker to it. Player base is small but due to change as the game gets older, and as of their 1st DLC rollout they plan on supporting the game but how they do it needs ALOT of work.

8/10 Play this untill Wargaming.net starts offering BJ's or War Thunder rolls out Naval combat... and Bj's.
Youtube.com/phboomharris for Mobile and PC gaming!

reviewText: I am a huge fan of Submarines and that is what drew me to this game. I started this game with little knowledge of what to expect. Tutorials work well and gameplay is very easy to catch on to. There is a lot of strategy involved and knowing your enemies. The graphics are a little lacking but gameplay defintely lets you overlook the graphics. Very easy to find games and research really isn't as bad as other grinding games, ie War Thunder and WOT/WOWS. I would recommend this game to anyone that wants the naval immersion and wants a war strategy game. Paying into the game really isn't needed but can give you some nice perks. Yolo swag 420 G2G

reviewText: This game has been very nicely developed. In November, like many other people, I liked the gameplay and the many features already in the game, but found the graphics and the ship handling not very appealing. I now see that the developers have worked on this. The graphics are much nicer, and there are already (slight) differences in how ships handle (turn, accelerate, decelerate).\n\nI appreciated that the developers didn't go overboard in marketing like Wargaming does. The latter company has been very competent in maximising short-term revenues (another premium ship special offer"

reviewText:
The mechanics similar to that of Navyfield 1, the graphics (almost) of World of Warships.
Really fun to play, and a fair bit of skill is required.

The community is small but growing as word is spreading.
World chat reminds me of the barrens in World of Warcraft. (assume its toxic)

Prices in the currency store are reasonable for VIP, not so much for ships.

Some of the client interactions lack usability, so don't assume that something works a way you'd expect.

I recommend this, however it does need work on the client side of things.

reviewText:
Its your classic 'free' to play type game. You don't have to spend a single nickle to enjoy it. Graphics are good. Sound is fine. Playerbase is rather small right now, which is unfortunate since some of the matches will end up 5v5.
Many people compare it to World of Warships.
I would recommend downloading it and giving it a whirl. You might find you like it.

Update - 20 hours in-game
Well, I have ranked up in-game and have several Tier IV ships. All fun to play.
Really enjoying playing the DD class since taking out unsuspecting BBs is fun as heck. Going into an artillery/torp duel with other DDs and CLs is fun as well. Kill or be killed.

Playerbase continues to be small, especially during the week days. Weekends are better and you will see the larger 16v16 battles. Competition mode is interesting when the playerbase gets larger.

Is it 'fun'? Sure is and I haven't had to spend a single dime on the game. Don't think I will either since at this point it still feels like a 'beta' game and we need to see whether it grows. Its a nice change of space from War Thunder, Armored Warfare and World of Tanks. I needed the ocean scenery I guess. LOL

Download, learn it and give it a whirl. Its different so it will keep you entertained for a while. Just be aware that you WILL have to watch for the match making engine to generate a game. Play smart and be a team player...its what these games are about. No Ram-boners.

reviewText: This game looked OK at first. I downloaded it, loaded it up and instantly noticed that it has no EU servers. Either that or there was and I couldn't change it. The second thing I noticed is that it had long, boring and unnessicary tutorials.\nThis brings me onto the gameplay... It's terrible. It is literally a unmistakable copy of Wargaming's two best F2P MMO shooters. It has the idea of World Of Warships, but the gameplay of World of Tanks. Which, in this case, makes me feel sick. It is clunky, slow and that drops me onto the final part of this mini-review.\nThis game is poorly optimised. I have a bad computer, yes. But it can run World of Warships, War Thunder and Valve's Team Fortress 2 fine, but this game was a joke in the FPS department.

reviewText:
Good game but no player. So skip it. In short, this game went from 3k players in november to 200-400 players a day. No advertisement for the game, and a Software Developement Kit available to some random (cheating) players made the playerbase left the game en masse in last december. Since then, its now horrible waiting time (no more cheat yet, but the harm was done) and silly matchmaking.

So, obviously, wrecked matchmaking with indecent waiting time kills all the fun past (and including) tier VII. And it can also happen in tier III/IV, so prepare to have a book, or alt tabbing browsing internet while trying to watch in the corner if the match launches... AFK matches ahead...

You should not spend a single penny on this game, but give it a try if you want, it still free.



Modif: So after 800+ hours playing this game, and see it dying days after days (no efforts from dev team to advertise it, strange banhammer on in game chat without warning nor explanations), i decided to uninstall it once and for all.

Dont get me wrong, you will find a very nice gameplay if you play this game, there is good content to play for hundred of hours of PvP fun... But without players, PvP aint fun....

reviewText: I love this game.  I have played WoWs for since closed beta and it was ok, but then I tried this game and it really took off for me.   What can I say.  It has subs, it has manual AA,  manual Secondaries.  The planes have fuel so they can not hover over your poor dd like in WoWs.  The planes can easily be destroyed using manual AA, unlike in WoWs where you can fire at them for a minute and be lucky to shoot down 2 of the 6.  The rng is more forgiving here when you fire.  The mm is a little weird as you can get in a match with a sub with all subs sometimes and no dds or you can have a dd and get in a game with no subs., but I figure the will work that out soon.  I would give this a 9.5 out of 10 if i could.  The graphics on ultra look good and the detail on a sub is amazing.  People say that the graphics are not as good here, but I do not see a difference much between the two games.  I will not be playign WoWs much if at all anymore.   Also, when you buy a 3000 gold pack with wows you get the 30 days and then enough gold for 1 ship port, here you get 30 days, plus enough gold to buy 4 port slots.  I think that they need to lower the premiums ships by like 10 or 20 bucks, but that is ok.

reviewText: I will admit, this game IS fun, IF you have the capacity and patience to play it. The waiting times for getting into games is like 4-5 minutes, at leaast with the games Ive had. And the match times are pretty quick, too. Again, Ive had around 3-5 minute matches with the waiting times. The only way Ill recommend this game to anyone is if they havent played World of Warships. Basically the same game with much prettier graphics, 2 second waiting times, and longer games, with a firing mechanic that doesnt just work off of luck, like world of tanks. Plus, if youve EVER played world of tanks, Youll realise something. THIS IS A CARBON COPY OF IT! Just with a naval skin over it! I will say this though, if it werent for the games unstable framerate of an unbalanced 15-50 fps on a GTX 970 paired with an Intel i7, and excrutiatingly long waiting times, I would play this more! But I cant get past how much of a carbon copy of World of Tanks it is! the ships move like theyre on wheels, rather than in water, they use the same firing system as World of tanks, they use the same advancing system as world of tanks, and in my personal opinion, world of warships is just a much more fleshed out naval combat game.\n\nTL,DR: Go play World of Warships, its more flesshed out, waiting times are non-existant compare to this, and, again, compared to this its basically photo-realism. This game is just a world of tanks skin.

reviewText:
Played the game long enough to play through the first training mission. The controls are a tad qwerky for me, but that can be overlooked.

I love the fact that you do have many options of customization (able to use different flags, paint, etc.)

What turned me off is the fact that playing this, I noticed that I am unable to aim or move the camera in any way while moving the ship. Not sure if this was a bug, an issue with my set-up or what, but that turned me off REALLY quickly. Also, was not happy with the movement options...either you are moving full steam ahead, full reverse, or not at all and the same can be said for movement to port & starboard as you either have the rudder full turn or straight ahead.

If these don't turn you away, then by all means please wait a 1/2 hour for the download and start playing away Cap'n...it is free after all

reviewText: Well here it is 12-22 and I have played the game every day rapidly moving up the ladder and regretfully it is my last time. The game as I said before is a thing of beauty. Great graphics, ambiance, etc. But, it is not free and while it appears that it is, in order to get to any real meat of course you have to pay. Gold, gold, gold begins to become the common mantra for anything. I should have seen this as it is obvious from all the screen areas to provide a quick hotline for your money. On top of that behavior problems are rampart and it appears that the immature jerks that love tk'ing just to cause trouble are not policed. As much as I loathe War Thunder you can still progress without a constant plea for more money and lame as it is, at least there is punishment for childish behaviour. One last warning, apparently one fleet from China, which bills itself as the best players are amazingly piggish,( stealing kills, team killing and not playing the game until all team mates are killed , so he can cash in on all the points at end ) and are not punished at all. So if you want to be taken advantage of , play your heart out for no gain while the subscribers wipe the floor with you, by all means waste your time. I can not play this anymore and will not return.

reviewText: Not sure where to start off at. The game does have some good mechanics, just horribly implemented. The graphics are absolute dog crap as well. reviewText:
For being a game that is on steam for FREE, all things considered, its pretty good. There are a bunch of pros and cons for the game, but overall its definitely an experience I quite enjoyed.

Pros:
- Absolutely nothing like WarThunder, which is what I thought it would be based around, this game has similarities to WarThunder, but overall it's completely different, which is great, because WarThunder is probably one of the most trash games on steam, especially with the millions of microtransactions they expect everyone to buy

- Great gameplay, not difficult to learn how to play, unlike warthunder, it is easy to get into, start playing, and join public matches, or private matches.

Cons:
- Pretty laggy on some occasions, its not my computer or internet, I think the game is just handling poorly, which could definitely be improved upon.

- Poor graphics, the graphics are pretty poor, even on high/ultra game settings, which is slightly dissapointing, even though the game would run considerably worse had there been better graphics.

- EXTREMELY laggy multiplayer, this I expected, if the game ran poorly in the first place, multiplayer wouldn't be any better, another thing that could be fixed in the future.

reviewText:
Definitely an enjoyable game, if you were once in the Navy or you just like playing with ships. Community of players is small right now, but there is potential. I enjoy the small, yet diverse classes of ships. I do hope they add marines to the ships for boarding action, or something involving amphibious operations. Developers have implemented want looks like a three strikes limit when it comes to any teamkiller, which boots the offender from the game for 24 hours. Not sure what happens to repeat offenders, so that is nice to take into account.

However, the major flaw for this game for me is communications. Use of communication is confusing and you are not sure if people heard you, which would be useful for someone who plays with the carrier's scout planes or using smaller ships to scout out enemies. If there any developers reading this, please try and fix this issue. Make it easier for someone to notify their fleet members or a heirarchy for a would-be fleet commander to issue orders.

Another issue, not for me of course yet, is modifications. Sometimes I would rather take off the AA guns and put on more artillery cannons and you can't. You can only upgrade the slots with equipment you have researched, which is acquired in combat.

Overall, I would give this a 7.5/10 and would recommend others to at least try this game before knocking it.

reviewText:
For being a game that is on steam for FREE, all things considered, its pretty good. There are a bunch of pros and cons for the game, but overall its definitely an experience I quite enjoyed.

Pros:
- Absolutely nothing like WarThunder, which is what I thought it would be based around, this game has similarities to WarThunder, but overall it's completely different, which is great, because WarThunder is probably one of the most trash games on steam, especially with the millions of microtransactions they expect everyone to buy

- Great gameplay, not difficult to learn how to play, unlike warthunder, it is easy to get into, start playing, and join public matches, or private matches.

Cons:
- Pretty laggy on some occasions, its not my computer or internet, I think the game is just handling poorly, which could definitely be improved upon.

- Poor graphics, the graphics are pretty poor, even on high/ultra game settings, which is slightly dissapointing, even though the game would run considerably worse had there been better graphics.

- EXTREMELY laggy multiplayer, this I expected, if the game ran poorly in the first place, multiplayer wouldn't be any better, another thing that could be fixed in the future.

reviewText:
Turn the graphics to ultra and they look just fine. Very little if any slowdown on my low-mid range rig. People on here saying the graphics are bad make me lol. lern2settings.

Fun game, think Battlestations Midway with more detailed ships and no direct control of aircraft; instead you manually line up attack runs which requires a bit of skill. Instead of merely having main calibre and AA, often ships have sub calibre as well as torpedoes and depth charges.

The game has a very arcady phisics engine compared to real life. That being said, I would not play a fully realistic naval simulator online because I don't have the literal ALL DAY it would take for a single match. You want this level of arcady because otherwise there would be very little to do. People complaining about the physics engine are fools, in real life it would take battleships miles and quite a few minutes to turn around completely. Does spending the first ten minutes of a match turning sound fun? I didn't think so.

Combat is about trying to predict where your opponent will be, and destroyers are nimble enough to dodge large calibres at long range. This creates a dynamic where submarines are excellent at hunting battleships and carriers, which have a range and firepower advantage against cruisers but whose weapons have difficulty hitting destroyers. Cruisers, however, are potent destroyer hunters because of their many accurate guns that have a range advantage. Finally you have destroyers (and light cruisers, to a lesser degree) who excel at submarine hunting, but whose main calibres are typically unable to damage ships classed cruiser and above. Destroyers have torpedoes, however, which can hit subs at shallow depth, and decimate any ship, as well as depth charges for antisubmarine duty.

This creates an interesting interdependence where destroyers and light cruisers act as scouts and spotters for battleships, and matches typically have these close range battles surrounded by long range skirmishers like battleships and carriers, who try and get hits in against the lighter ships. Once this phase ends, the side with scouts hunts down the remaining enemies. e.g. Typically a lone battleship will have a great difficulty against several destroyers, however victory is still possible with a cool head and good positioning. It would be a much different story, however, if it was a lone destroyer against two or three battleships. The balance in the game reflects reality without sacrificing fun simply by limiting the amount of larger ships on either side - you wont see 10 BB and 2 DD on a team, for example. Every ship has a role and straying too far from your duties is a detriment to the team. If the battleships on one side rush its GG for them unless the other team makes some fatal mistakes as well.

Individual skill plays a major role and is well depicted in the battles within your range bracket. In a fight between destroyers, the better captain can win by quite a margin in most cases, so you never feel like you're simply giving and recieving damage at predetermined rates merely waiting for one side to die after doing a certain amount of damage in return. There is no RNG either as all shots, even the dropped bombs and torpedoes from aircraft, are manually aimed. The only things that aren't are the machine guns on the ships and fighters who have AI to kill bombers and scouts. You even get manually controlled flak cannons on your ships, and if you dont use them because you have tunnlevision on the target and didn't notice the bombers coming in then you're going to end up spectating for the rest of the match. There is a real sense of danger during battle, as the slightest mistake can have serious consequences, and no ship is more than one solid volley from a battlship or one spread of torpedoes away from going down.

Overall this game has been quite enjoyable so far and for the low price of free, if you haven't downloaded it already you may be showing early signs of a rare form of alzheimer's that causes you to forget how awesome WW2 naval battles are. If so, download this game and go to a doctor.

reviewText:
The Most Important thing in this game is Teamwork.

Destroyers are the Eyes and Battleships are the Hammers.

If play a Battleship and your destroyer lights up a target - Kill It.
If you play a CL or CA and your destroyer lights up a DD, CL or CA - Kill It.

If your destoyers are out of your gun range (You can't hit what they see), move up untill you can hit it and kill it.

That being said, Enemy Destroyers should be killed first as this gives your subs more room to play.
Then target enemy CL's. After this is done, your enemy BB's and CA's are blind.

Submarines are scouts too. They are also terrifying to BB's that are defenseless against them. Support your submarines and defend them from the DD that is trying to Torp and Depth Charge them.

DD's should SCOUT and ONLY SCOUT. Their PRIMARY JOB is to SCOUT. Their Secondary Job is to Kill UNSUPORTED Submarines (See above). DD's will get the occasional kill against lighter ships, but they should not charge in. This is a mistake that carries over from the T1 and T2 games.

Please understand that you cannot be Rambo in this game. You will die and your TEAM will lose.

Download it. Play it. Have fun.

reviewText: Steel Ocean with its quick matches ranging from 4v4 to as many as 14v14 isnt that bad of a game. You can play ships from 6 different countries. U.k with 27 different ships, 2 of which are bought with gold. Japan with 51 ships 10 bought with gold, Germany with 28 ships 3 bought with gold, United States with 40 ships 4 bought with gold, China with only one teir V11 ship only bought with gold and  France with its one teir V111 ship bought with gold. Gold in this game is real money. So if you plan on playing this game alot you are most likly going to throw down some real cash at some point. And things could depending on what you want get pretty spendy with $1.01 = out to 500 gold and as you get higher in your teir the prices go up. And with Ship expantion slots costing gold as well as paint jobs and flags for your ships even ammunition. You can start to see what I mean. Over all Not a bad game. Graphicly speaking looks good sound and movment totaly fine. But a bit repetative sometimes. there are about 5 maps maybe a couple more. I never counted. I have played for over 70 hours and probably only spend $50.

reviewText:
If you plan to play this in any country other than North America (Where the Main Server is located, wait... the ONLY server is located) then i suggest don't play the game.

Constant server disconnects, dropping connection, the list goes on.

The controls feel like you're driving a sluggish passenger ferry and there's no individuality that the game has to offer. Steel Ocean doesn't set itself apart from any other Naval Strategy game apart from adding submarines which is the main factor i downloaded the game in the first place.

Graphics are decent and the controls are alright i suppose. But i suggest if you want to play a fun, enjoyable and immersive game. Either wait a year for the game to get some major updates or move onto similar games like WoWS (World of War Ships) if you are looking for something a little more immersive.

I currently have about an hour and i can already tell it's Pay2Win, and the tech tree isn't complete on many sides/countries.

reviewText:
Hello my friend and my NavyFIELD comrade, This reviews  is My Steam Greenlight of this game. About the difference of WOWS & Steel Ocean.

The first is the birth of time:
Steel Ocean arrive Two months earlier than the WOWS by Alpha test. So, We can not simply think that How is Copy.

I'm this game the SteelOcean bate tester in China and I'm WOWS Alpha tester, NavyFIELD Official tester too.

Difference of the Steel Ocean and World of Warship:

I played this game in the Chinese server and I'm WOWS USA Server and China Server Close bate Tester, this game is full different of the WOWS and it's like Tanke of World.

Make a simple comparison:

Image Quality: WOWS significantly ahead Steel Ocean;

The Ship Simulation: WOWS is more real and SO is to Fast of Ship turn.

But Rich content: SO ahead WOWS, That have more types of vessels（For example Submarine, We know that WOWS have NOT Submarine）and richer game mode（For example Night fighting and Flagship Mode）.

And the biggest difference is the rhythm. SO is more fast paced and WOWS is dull. Map of WOWS is larger and SO smaller. However, little difference between the actual Navigate time.

I think the simulation is bad of the Steel Ocean, but a better like to a game".

And I would recommend it to my comrades in NavyFIELD."
voteText: 18 of 40 people (45%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Don't belive those who call this a WoWs copy, This game was released in April 2015 in China, while World of Warships was released in September 2015.

The only relationship this game have with WOWS is they both in the same genre, if you think this game is a copy of WoWS then all FPS ever made is a Copy of Wolfenstein 3D.

The game offer much enjoyable arcade gameplay experince than WoWs, the game is also a lot more complex than simple minded WoWS.

Pros+
1. full control over you ships everysingle weapon and support system can be used, while WoWs only have very limited control over you ship, for example battleships in WoWS only have main guns, but in this game you get to manually use the secondary and AA guns.
2. More ships in game for each nation and more nations
3. Submarine
4. larger load out customization options.
5. Night battle.

Cons-
1. Poor optimization, for a game that use a old Engine (Unreal Engine 3) there should be no excuse for that.
2. Dated graphics.
3. Certain Pay 2 win elements.

reviewText:
Don't belive those who call this a WoWs copy, This game was released in April 2015 in China, while World of Warships was released in September 2015.

The only relationship this game have with WOWS is they both in the same genre, if you think this game is a copy of WoWS then all FPS ever made is a Copy of Wolfenstein 3D.

The game offer much enjoyable arcade gameplay experince than WoWs, the game is also a lot more complex than simple minded WoWS.

Pros+
1. full control over you ships everysingle weapon and support system can be used, while WoWs only have very limited control over you ship, for example battleships in WoWS only have main guns, but in this game you get to manually use the secondary and AA guns.
2. More ships in game for each nation and more nations
3. Submarine
4. larger load out customization options.
5. Night battle.

Cons-
1. Poor optimization, for a game that use a old Engine (Unreal Engine 3) there should be no excuse for that.
2. Dated graphics.
3. Certain Pay 2 win elements.

reviewText:
Hello my friend and my NavyFIELD comrade, This reviews  is My Steam Greenlight of this game. About the difference of WOWS & Steel Ocean.

The first is the birth of time:
Steel Ocean arrive Two months earlier than the WOWS by Alpha test. So, We can not simply think that How is Copy.

I'm this game the SteelOcean bate tester in China and I'm WOWS Alpha tester, NavyFIELD Official tester too.

Difference of the Steel Ocean and World of Warship:

I played this game in the Chinese server and I'm WOWS USA Server and China Server Close bate Tester, this game is full different of the WOWS and it's like Tanke of World.

Make a simple comparison:

Image Quality: WOWS significantly ahead Steel Ocean;

The Ship Simulation: WOWS is more real and SO is to Fast of Ship turn.

But Rich content: SO ahead WOWS, That have more types of vessels（For example Submarine, We know that WOWS have NOT Submarine）and richer game mode（For example Night fighting and Flagship Mode）.

And the biggest difference is the rhythm. SO is more fast paced and WOWS is dull. Map of WOWS is larger and SO smaller. However, little difference between the actual Navigate time.

I think the simulation is bad of the Steel Ocean, but a better like to a game".

And I would recommend it to my comrades in NavyFIELD."
